alert.note: Alert for Marion; Schley; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion, north central Schley and southwestern Taylor Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Charing, or near Butler. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Butler, Rupert, Charing and Mauk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
